Our lab leverages artificial intelligence and high-performance computing to tackle key challenges in materials science.
We develop scalable machine learning methods that accelerate first-principles simulations of electronic and atomistic structures, with the overarching goal of discovering and designing novel materials.

---

Our research is driven by a passion for fundamental discovery and a commitment to developing practical solutions to real-world challenges in materials science.
We are always looking for talented individuals to join our team and contribute to exciting new projects.

To learn more about our work, check out the latest [News](news.qmd) from our lab, explore our [Research Highlights](research/highlights.qmd) for detailed insights into ongoing projects, and get to know the [People](people.qmd) behind our lab. You can also visit our [Publications](publications.qmd) page for a comprehensive list of our scientific contributions, and find pedagogical materials on machine learning and materials science under [Teaching](teaching.qmd).

---

Our lab is a [research department](https://www.casus.science/?page_id=4660){target="_blank"} of the [Center for Advanced Systems Understanding](https://www.casus.science){target="_blank"} at the [Helmholtz-Zentrum Dresden-Rossendorf](https://www.hzdr.de){target="_blank"}.
